name: ESSAI 2026
venue: European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence, Vienna, Austria
description: The 2026 European Summer School on Artificial Intelligence (ESSAI) will take place in Vienna, Austria from 6 to 10 July 2026. It offers a week of introductory and advanced AI courses, tutorials, and social activities aimed at PhD students, young researchers, and senior scholars. The program, organized by EurAI, features over 30 lecturers, six parallel tracks, and networking opportunities, including a reception at Vienna City Hall.

name: OpenEuroLLM Winter School
venue: Skeikampen conference hotel, near Oslo, Norway
description: The 2026 Winter School on Multilinguality in LLM Development and Evaluation is organized by the Nordic Language Processing Laboratory and the OpenEuroLLM project, taking place at the Skeikampen conference hotel north of Oslo, Norway. It targets NLP researchers, especially those from EuroHPC consortium countries and doctoral students, and aims to strengthen collaboration across European research teams while providing hands‑on technical presentations on multilingual large language models. The program includes expert talks, walk‑throughs of EuroHPC experience reports, and networking opportunities, with subsidized participation and free bus transfers from Oslo Airport.

name: Probabilistic AI School
description: ProbAI School 2026 is a Probabilistic AI summer school taking place in Vilnius, Lithuania. The program aims to provide an inclusive educational environment covering state‑of‑the‑art machine learning and artificial intelligence topics. It welcomes enthusiasts, students, academics, and industry professionals to learn and collaborate.

name: BMVA Computer Vision Summer School
description: The 29th BMVA Computer Vision Summer School will be held at Durham University in Durham, England, UK. It offers an intensive week of lectures and lab sessions covering a broad range of computer‑vision topics presented by leading researchers from the UK and abroad. The programme includes daily oral talks and hands‑on sessions aimed at students and professionals seeking advanced training in the field.

name: Oxford Machine Learning Summer School 2026
description: OxML Summer 2026 is a machine‑learning school organized by Oxford ML School, offering both in‑person sessions in Oxford and online participation. The programme features three specialised tracks taught by world‑renowned experts from leading AI labs in academia and industry, allowing participants to customise their learning path. Applications are not yet open, with prospective attendees invited to register interest to be notified when registration begins.

name: Robotics, Perception and Learning (RPL) Summer School
venue: KTH Royal Institute of Technology, Stockholm, Sweden
description: The RPL Summer School 2026, organized by the Department for Robotics, Perception and Learning at KTH Royal Institute of Technology in Stockholm, Sweden, targets doctoral and postdoctoral researchers. It covers a broad range of topics in robotics, perception and learning, including machine learning, computer vision, human‑robot interaction, planning and decision making, and combines keynote talks, industry panels and brainstorming sessions. The six‑day event, held at the Happy Tammsvik resort, provides fully funded accommodation, meals and activities to foster new collaborations and concrete research ideas.

name: Machine Learning Crash Course at MALGA
venue: Università di Genova, Via Dodecaneso 35, Genova, Italy
description: The MLCC2026 Summer School – Machine Learning Crash Course – is a five‑day in‑person program held at the Università di Genova’s DIBRIS/DIMA building in Genoa, Italy. It offers an introduction to fundamental machine‑learning concepts and algorithms through lectures and practical lab sessions, targeting undergraduate and graduate students as well as professionals. Participants receive university credit upon successful completion and benefit from direct interaction with MaLGa Center faculty, with all activities conducted on campus and no online streaming.

name: UK Robotics Summer School
venue: National Robotarium, Heriot-Watt University, Edinburgh, United Kingdom
description: The UK Robotics Summer School 2026 is a five‑day program held at the National Robotarium, Heriot‑Watt University in Edinburgh, United Kingdom. It offers expert‑led lectures, tutorials and industry talks covering bio‑inspired robotics, healthcare robotics, generative AI, validation of AI methods and real‑world applications. Aimed at master’s‑level students and industry practitioners, the school provides hands‑on experience with state‑of‑the‑art robots and networking opportunities.

name: International Summer School for Advanced Studies on Biometrics, Behavior, and Vision
description: The 2026 Biometrics Summer School takes place at Hotel Dei Pini in Alghero, Sardinia, Italy. It focuses on the impact of generative AI and large foundation models on biometric and human recognition technologies, covering machine learning, image understanding, signal analysis, neuroscience, robotics, forensic and digital forensics. The program is aimed at PhD students, post‑docs, researchers, forensic examiners and professionals, offering intensive lectures by leading experts, hands‑on sessions, and opportunities for scholarships and networking.

name: 1st Internationa School on the Cognitive, Ethical, and Societal Dimensions of AI - AIces
description: AIces 2026 is the first International School on the Cognitive, Ethical and Societal Dimensions of Artificial Intelligence, held in Porto, Portugal from 30 March to 2 April 2026. The program targets graduate students, postgraduate students and industry practitioners, offering parallel courses, symposia, and open debates covering cognition, ethics, and society in AI. Participants can attend in person or online, receive a certificate, and have access to recorded lectures for 45 days after the event.

name: Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal (ELS) aspects of AI and AS at Umeå University
description: The Winter School on Ethical, Legal, and Societal aspects of AI and Autonomous Systems brings together researchers and students to explore the interdisciplinary challenges of responsible AI. It offers a program of lectures, hands‑on multidisciplinary training, a poster session and a social program to foster networking and professional exchange. The event takes place at Umeå University in Sweden from 11 to 13 March 2026.

name: Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM 2026)
description: The Winter School on Social Robotics, Artificial Intelligence and Multimedia (SoRAIM) 2026 takes place at the Escandille in Autrans, France. It aims to bring together researchers from fields such as computer vision, speech/audio processing, and human‑robot interaction to foster cross‑disciplinary exchange through courses and informal interactions. The program features expert talks and a hands‑on session covering topics like affective signal processing, conversational speech synthesis, and multimodal dialogue, set against the backdrop of the Vercors mountains for networking and outdoor activities.

name: Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) Melbourne
description: The 2026 Machine Learning Summer School (MLSS) takes place at the Sandridge Events Centre in Melbourne, Australia. It is a two‑week, in‑person program aimed at 50 hand‑picked PhD students and early‑career researchers, featuring world‑class speakers from academia and industry. The curriculum covers core machine‑learning theory and explores research beyond large language models, including topics such as deep learning, generative modeling, and geometric deep learning.

name: Northern Lights Deep Learning Winter School
venue: UiT – The Arctic University of Norway, Tromsø, Norway
description: The 2027 Winter School on Deep Learning is part of the Northern Lights Deep Learning Conference in Tromsø, Norway. It runs from 12 to 14 January 2027 and is hosted by UiT – The Arctic University of Norway. The school covers recent advances in deep learning such as image classification, object detection, segmentation, time‑series prediction and speech recognition, aiming to bring together researchers for knowledge exchange and collaboration.

name: Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS)
description: The Sixth Annual Nepal AI School (ANAIS) is an 11‑day intensive program offering AI lectures, hands‑on labs, and project work. It covers topics from fundamental mathematics and statistics to cutting‑edge AI methods and applications across domains such as computer vision, NLP, and medical science. The school targets senior undergraduates, graduate students, PhD candidates, faculty, and industry professionals, bringing together over 500 in‑person participants and thousands of online viewers.

name: EEML Summer School
description: The Eastern European Machine Learning Summer School takes place in Cetinje, Montenegro from 27 July to 1 August 2026. It features lectures and tutorials by leading researchers from institutions such as Google DeepMind, University of Oxford, EPFL, and many others, covering a broad range of machine‑learning topics. The program targets students and early‑career researchers seeking advanced ML knowledge and offers valuable networking opportunities with academia and industry.

name: Mediterranean Summer School
venue: University of Split Faculty of Electrical Engineering, Mechanical Engineering and Naval Architecture, Split, Croatia
description: The 2025 Mediterranean Machine Learning (M2L) Summer School is a five‑day program of keynotes, lectures and hands‑on sessions led by international AI experts. It targets doctoral and outstanding master students, as well as academics and practitioners, offering opportunities to present research, receive feedback, and network through social and cultural activities. The school covers a broad range of topics such as computer vision, natural language processing, generative models, reinforcement learning, and ethics in machine learning.

name: Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI
venue: Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications, Rabat, Morocco
description: The 2nd edition of the AI Summer School on Multimodal Foundation Models and Generative AI is a five‑day immersive program held at the Institut National des Postes et Télécommunications in Rabat, Morocco. It targets master’s and Ph.D. students, post‑docs, and early‑career researchers, offering expert lectures, hands‑on labs, and project mentorship on state‑of‑the‑art multimodal and generative AI techniques. The school also emphasizes networking and leadership development through collaborations with MoroccoAI, IMT Nord Europe, and industry partners.

name: AthNLP Summer School 2026
description: The Athens Natural Language Processing Summer School 2026 (AthNLP) will be held at the NCSR Demokritos campus in Athens, Greece. The week-long program, running from September 3 to September 9, brings together experts from RC Athena, NCSR Demokritos, Athens University of Economics and Business, and Heriot‑Watt University to cover recent advances in NLP. Further details about the curriculum and registration will be announced in the coming weeks.

name: Advanced Artificial Intelligence: GenAI & Deep Unsupervised Learning
venue: Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, United Kingdom
description: The Advanced Artificial Intelligence and Machine Learning summer school at Lady Margaret Hall, Oxford, focuses on generative AI and deep unsupervised learning techniques. It provides theoretical foundations and hands‑on experience with clustering, GANs, self‑supervised learning, and other state‑of‑the‑art models across various real‑world domains. The programme is aimed at STEM students with intermediate AI/ML knowledge who are considering graduate study or research, and it is offered both residentially and online.

name: AI4Science Summer School
description: The 2nd Summer School on Advancing Scientific Discovery with AI brings together PhD students, post‑doctoral researchers and scientists to explore how artificial intelligence can accelerate scientific research. The program covers machine learning for data analysis, AI‑driven experimental design, generative models, and the integration of AI with physical simulations, featuring hands‑on workshops using Python libraries such as NumPy and PyTorch. Held in Caen, Normandy, France in 2025, the school aims to equip participants with practical AI skills for interdisciplinary scientific discovery.

name: LUT Summer School
description: LUT Summer School 2026 is a one‑week intensive programme on the Lappeenranta campus offering courses on sustainability, climate action, marketing, management, inventive thinking and the intersection of business and technology. It is aimed at bachelor’s and master’s students from any university who wish to gain 3 ECTS credits while experiencing Finnish summer nature and a vibrant social programme. The school combines workshops, group work and outdoor activities, providing both academic depth and networking opportunities in an international setting.

name: Armenian LLM Summer School 2025
description: The LLM Summer School 2026 is an intensive program for students and researchers focusing on the latest advancements in Large Language Models. It will be held in Yerevan, Armenia and will feature a combination of lectures, hands‑on workshops, and a hackathon where participants can apply their knowledge to innovative projects. The event is part of an annual series that aims to provide comprehensive training and networking opportunities in the field of LLMs.
